snippet: Senate Democrats are beginning a push to renew the Violence Against Women Act, the once broadly bipartisan 1994 legislation that now faces fierce opposition from conservatives.
abstract: Senate Democrats are beginning a push to renew the Violence Against Women Act, the once broadly bipartisan 1994 legislation that now faces fierce opposition from conservatives; law would expand financing for and broaden the reach of domestic violence programs; Democrats, confident they have the political upper hand with women, insist Republican opposition falls into a larger picture of insensitivity toward women.
lead_paragraph: Senate Democrats are beginning a push to renew the Violence Against Women Act, the once broadly bipartisan 1994 legislation that now faces fierce opposition from conservatives.

headline.seo: Violence Against Women Act Divides Senate
headline.main: Women Figure Anew in Senate’s Latest Battle
headline.print_headline: Women Figure Anew in Senate’s Latest Battle
